
## Diagnose a statistical model and data generating process {.unnumbered}


### Description

#' Diagnose a Statistical Model and Data Generating Process



### Usage

<pre><code class='language-R'>diagnose(dgp, fit, alpha = 0.05, N = 100, dgp_parameters = NULL)
</code></pre>


### Arguments

<table>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="dgp">dgp</code></td>
<td>
A function that generates a dataset. This function should return
a data frame when called, and optionally accept parameters passed via
'dgp_parameters'.
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="fit">fit</code></td>
<td>
A function that fits the model to the data generated by 'dgp'.
This function should return a data frame with columns including
'estimator', 'term', 'estimate', and optionally 'p.value', 'conf.low',
and 'conf.high'.
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="alpha">alpha</code></td>
<td>
A numeric value between 0 and 1 indicating the significance
level for hypothesis tests (default is 0.05).
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="N">N</code></td>
<td>
An integer specifying the number of repetitions of the simulation
to perform (default is 100).
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="dgp_parameters">dgp_parameters</code></td>
<td>
An optional data frame specifying parameter values
to be passed to the 'dgp' function. Each row corresponds to a parameter
configuration for a single DGP run. If 'NULL', the 'dgp' function is
called without additional parameters.
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="truth">truth</code></td>
<td>
A numeric value representing the true value of the parameter
being estimated. This is used to compute bias, RMSE, and coverage.
</td></tr>
</table>


### Details

This function evaluates the performance of a statistical model (or estimator)
against data generated from a specified data generating process (DGP). It computes
various diagnostic metrics, including root mean squared error (RMSE), bias, power,
and confidence interval coverage.

The function assumes that the 'fit' function returns a data frame containing
at least the following columns:
- 'estimator': Identifier for the model or method.
- 'term': The name of the parameter being estimated.
- 'estimate': The estimated value of the parameter.

Additional columns such as 'p.value', 'conf.low', and 'conf.high' are used
for computing power and coverage metrics if they are present.

The &lsquo;dgp_parameters' argument allows for systematic variation of the DGP&rsquo;s
inputs across simulations. For each parameter configuration (a row in
'dgp_parameters'), the DGP is called, and the resulting data is passed to
the 'fit' function.



### Value

A data frame summarizing the diagnostic metrics:


<dl>
<dt>rmse</dt><dd>Root mean squared error of the estimates.
</dd>
<dt>bias</dt><dd>Mean bias of the estimates.
</dd>
<dt>power</dt><dd>Proportion of times the null hypothesis is rejected
(if 'p.value' column exists).
</dd>
<dt>coverage</dt><dd>Proportion of times the confidence interval covers the
true value (if 'conf.low' and 'conf.high' columns exist).
</dd>
</dl>

Each row corresponds to a combination of 'estimator', 'term', and other
grouping variables.
